summary: Henry B. Gonzalez is mentioned in the context of payroll records for the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Specifically, his name appears as an authorizing official on payroll authorization forms for HSCA staff. This indicates his role in approving and overseeing the financial administration of the committee. The documents primarily consist of payroll records, final determination notifications from the Assassination Records Review Board regarding the postponement of Social Security numbers to protect personal privacy, and related correspondence. The timeline of his involvement is primarily during the period when the HSCA was active, particularly in 1976 and 1977. A notable pattern is his consistent presence as an authorizing figure on payroll documents, suggesting a level of administrative responsibility within the HSCA.
significance: Henry B. Gonzalez's significance in the JFK assassination context lies in his role as an authorizing official within the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). While the documents do not reveal specific investigative actions, his signature on payroll documents indicates his involvement in the administrative and financial operations of the committee, which was tasked with investigating the assassination of President John F. Kennedy.
